p: The goal of surgical treatment for RCC is twofold: the first is the removal of the renal tumor with negative surgical margins via either partial or radical nephrectomy based on the tumor characteristics of size and location. This can be accomplished via an open or minimally invasive (robotic) approach. The second goal is the preservation of renal function. Most guidelines agree that partial nephrectomy should be performed for the renal mass when feasible to maximally preserve kidney function and prevent end stage renal disease.
